New Records: Freddie Freeman hit a home run in every World Series game this series.
Anthony Volpe made history as the first player to record four-plus RBIs and two stolen bases in a World Series game.
Key Match Events: Anthony Volpe hit a grand slam in the bottom of the third to make it 5-2.
Gleyber Torres responded with a three-run homer in the bottom of the eighth to extend New York's lead to 10-4.
Aaron Judge recorded his first RBI of the World Series with a base hit in the bottom of the eighth.
Luis Gil started Game 4 for the Yankees, while the Dodgers went with a bullpen game.
Pre-Game Insights: Dave Roberts has made the first of what will be many pitching changes for the Dodgers in Game 4.
The Dodgers are using a bullpen game for the fourth time of the 2024 postseason, having gone 2-1 so far in the relief-pitcher committee approach.
Jazz Chisholm Jr. echoed the desire to make history in his postgame presser.
Austin Wells returned to the starting lineup after Jose Trevino replaced him in Game 3's loss Monday.
Post-Match Reflections: No team has ever come back from a 3-0 series deficit in the World Series, but the Yankees are still alive.
Luis Gil maintained his momentum to keep the score at 5-2.
The Yankees' captain lined an RBI single to left in the bottom of the eighth inning to score Juan Soto, who doubled, and extend the lead over the Dodgers to 11-4.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Freddie Freeman extended his historic World Series home run streak to six games on Tuesday, hitting a two-run shot off New York Yankees starter Luis Gil in the first inning of Game 4.
The Yankees' most runs in a World Series game since 1978 was achieved in Game 4.
The Dodgers failed to break out the brooms in the Bronx on Tuesday.
Others: The Yankees forced Game 5 of the 2024 World Series after defeating the Los Angeles Dodgers 11-4.
Ashanti performed the national anthem prior to Game 4 of the World Series at Yankee Stadium.
Paul O'Neill will throw the ceremonial first pitch in Game 4.
